;;医生脖子上的听诊器
;

;全球卫生机构要求国际政府紧急淘汰化石燃料和随着卫生专业人员越来越多地看到患者遭受气候变化造成的伤害，快速发展可再生能源。

;

;代表全球超过 300 万卫生专业人员的世界领先的全科医生和卫生机构将于周六发表一封公开信呼吁采取紧急行动应对气候变化，保护社区健康。

;

;“我们世界各地的家庭医生、医生和卫生专业人员呼吁世界领导人采取紧急行动，保护全球人民的健康公开信中写道。

;

;来自 39 个主要卫生机构（包括澳大利亚全科医生和农村医学最高机构）的签名者表示，他们已经看到气候变化对人类健康造成的广泛影响他们的患者。

;
;

;;相关：;;科学家警告说，地球的“生命体征”比人类历史上任何时候都更糟糕;

;
;

;“作为一线卫生工作者，我们他们越来越多地应对气候危机引发的卫生紧急情况。

;
    ;
  • ;

    ;;;注册澳大利亚卫报的免费上午和下午电子邮件通讯，获取每日新闻综述;;

    ;
    • ;
;

;“然而，在脸上伤害和痛苦不断增加，新的化石燃料资源不断开发，温室气体排放量持续增加。”

;

;签署方包括来自加拿大、印度、欧洲、太平洋国家和英国的卫生机构，他们要求所有政府停止扩大任何新的化石燃料基础设施和生产，逐步淘汰现有燃料，取消补贴并投资可再生能源。

;

;“如果我们有机会将升温限制在 1.5 摄氏度，信中写道：“为了阻止气候健康紧急情况的升级，我们必须结束化石燃料的扩散。”

;

;澳大利亚全科医生最高机构主席妮可·希金斯 (Nicole Higgins) 表示，澳大利亚和世界需要为气候变化对健康的影响做好准备。

;
;

;;相关：;;吃植物并使用电力：如何打破食物电视的不良气候习惯;

;
;

;“澳大利亚正在为预测做好准备这是自黑色星期六以来最严重的丛林火灾季节之一，这再次提醒我们新的“正常”是什么样子，”希金斯说。

;

;“预防行动至关重要，全科医生可以发挥重要作用参与，包括讨论和激励患者根据当地气候威胁及其个人情况和健康需求制定应急计划。”

;

;世界卫生组织环境、气候变化和健康主任玛丽亚·内拉 (Maria Neira)，称空气污染每年导致超过 700 万人过早死亡。

;

;“气候变化已被确定为 21 世纪潜在的最大健康挑战，”Neira 说。

;

;该呼吁恰逢悉尼主办世界医生会议，卫生机构在会上讨论本国在气候变化方面的经验及其对患者健康和福祉的影响。

; Sat, 28 Oct 2023 08:52:01 +0800 Hunt on for book containing Wilkie Collins’s criticism of friend Dickenshttps://www.theguardian.com/books/2023/oct/28/hunt-on-for-book-containing-wilkie-collinss-criticism-of-friend-dickens
;;2023-10-27T23:01:00Z;
;
;;手写注释打开的书
;

;查尔斯·狄更斯可能被许多人誉为最伟大的维多利亚小说家，但一位密友在这位作家去世后并没有反对激烈的批评。

;

;《白衣女人》的作者威尔基·柯林斯 (Wilkie Collins) 与狄更斯合作创作戏剧和小说，两人有着长期、亲密的友谊直到 1870 年狄更斯去世。

;

;虽然他们对彼此的作品有共同的看法，但直到狄更斯去世后，威尔基才透露了他对朋友的一些主要作品的真实想法。

;

;柯林斯在约翰·福斯特的《查尔斯·狄更斯的一生》副本中手写的笔记，在 1889 年柯林斯去世后在柯林斯的图书馆中被发现，表明他是毫不留情的。

;

;现在正在寻找那份带注释的副本福斯特的书最后一次在拍卖会上出售是在 1890 年，当时是在查尔斯博物馆举行的一场名为“共同的朋友：查尔斯·狄更斯和威尔基·柯林斯的历险记”的展览上出售的。伦敦狄更斯博物馆。;

; ;

;根据柯林斯的说法，《巴纳比·拉奇》是“狄更斯写过的最弱的书”。关于《董贝父子》的后半部分，他写道：“任何聪明人读完后都会对它的糟糕性感到惊讶。”

;

;狄更斯未完成的最后一部作品《埃德温·德鲁德之谜》是“疲惫大脑的忧郁工作”。尽管《雾都孤儿》是一本“精彩”的书，但它的缺陷是“结构极其糟糕”。

;

;柯林斯指出，南希这个角色“是他创作过的最好的角色”。此后他再也没有看到过一个女人性格的所有方面——看到了她周围的一切。能够创造南希的同一个人创造了第二个董贝夫人，这是我所知道的文学中最令人费解的反常现象。”

;

;在书的第一页，福斯特宣称狄更斯是“最受欢迎的小说家”世纪之花”，柯林斯补充道“在沃尔特·斯科特之后”。

; ;

;1890 年 1 月 22 日由 Puttick and Simpson 拍卖行出售，该书的下落不明。柯林斯的笔记记录在 1890 年 1 月 20 日的《颇尔美尔公报》上一篇预览拍卖的文章中。

;

;展览策展人艾玛·哈珀 (Emma Harper) 表示，该复制品是“未经修饰的宝库”一位伟大作家对另一位伟大作家和朋友的看法”。由于柯林斯写给狄更斯的信中只有三封幸存下来，“我们将非常感谢有关其今天下落的任何信息”。

;

;展览将探讨两人之间的联系、他们的写作伙伴关系、旅行和戏剧作品，并且是第一个献给柯林斯的。活动将于2024年11月15日至2月25日举行，纪念他诞辰二百周年。它还将审查柯林斯完成《埃德温·德鲁德之谜》的建议。

;

;威尔基也赞扬了狄更斯。在 1860 年版《白衣女人》的序言中，他将狄更斯的《两座城市的故事》描述为“他笔下有史以来最完美的建构艺术作品”。

;

;保罗·刘易斯 (Paul Lewis) BBC 广播四台《Money Box》的主持人、柯林斯信件的编辑兼威尔基·柯林斯协会秘书表示，我们必须感谢普蒂克拍卖会上的转录员。他补充道：“任何抄写过威尔基文章的人都知道他们面临的困难，我们不能确定他们是否准确或完整地抄写了所有评论。因此，用这些笔和铅笔评论恢复原卷将是对柯林斯学术的真正礼物。手指交叉！”

;

;共同朋友的详细信息：查尔斯·狄更斯和查尔斯·狄更斯的历险记威尔基·柯林斯 (Wilkie Collins)，位于查尔斯·狄更斯博物馆 (Charles Dickens Museum)，地址：48 Doughty Street, Holborn，;可访问 www.dickensmuseum.com;

; Sat, 28 Oct 2023 07:22:02 +0800 Judge rejects Ivanka Trump’s argument against testifying at father’s fraud trialhttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/oct/27/ivanka-trump-testify-fraud-trial
;;2023-10-27T16:10:48Z;
;
;;唐纳德·特朗普、伊万卡·特朗普、埃里克·特朗普和小唐纳德·特朗普坐成一排
;

;A纽约法官驳回了伊万卡·特朗普的论点，即她不应该在父亲唐纳德·特朗普的欺诈案审判中作证。

;

;伊万卡·特朗普的律师 - 她已经聘请了与她父亲不同的法律团队 - 于周五，我们反对纽约总检察长利蒂西亚·詹姆斯办公室发出的作证传票，该办公室对前总统、他的长子和其他特朗普高管提起了价值 2.5 亿美元的欺诈案。

;
;

;;相关：;;法官对特朗普处以 10,000 美元罚款违反了禁言令，并说他作为证人“不可信”;

;
;

;“归根结底，法官大人，他们对她没有管辖权，”伊万卡·特朗普的律师贝内特·莫斯科维茨告诉法官。她的律师辩称，特朗普不再居住在纽约，并于 2017 年辞去了在特朗普集团的职务。

;

;伊万卡·特朗普一直是该案的被告，直到今年夏天，上诉法院表示具体情况对她的指控已经过时了。她的兄弟小唐纳德·特朗普和埃里克·特朗普仍被列为本案被告。

;

;法官阿瑟·恩戈伦 (Arthur Engoron) 告诉法庭，他驳回了她的论点，称她“明显利用了自己的特权”。他说，他在纽约做生意，并引用了文件显示特朗普在纽约仍然有财产和商业联系。

;

;这位前总统和他的成年子女都在该州的证人名单上。特朗普表示，他计划出庭作证。虽然特朗普和他的孩子如果拒绝作证不会面临牢狱之灾，但法官在裁决案件时可以利用任何缺席的情况来对他不利。由于这是法庭审判，没有陪审团，法官是案件的唯一裁决者。

;

;前总统的主要律师之一克里斯托弗·基斯 (Christopher Kise) 周五在法庭上表示，总检察长的办公室“只是想对特朗普总统的另一个孩子进行另一场混战”，并指责总检察长办公室制造了一场“媒体事件”。

;

;审判于周五结束了法庭的第四周预计将持续到 12 月 22 日，但也可能会更早结束。特朗普前律师兼调解人迈克尔·科恩本周发表了备受关注的证词，这是他首次在法庭上对他的前雇主出庭作证。

;

;特朗普被指控在财务报表上夸大其资产价值，提高他的净资产。恩戈隆在预审判决中认定特朗普犯有欺诈罪，下令吊销其营业执照，并终止特朗普在该州开展业务的能力，尽管特朗普正在对该裁决提出上诉。审判的其余部分将用于确定特朗普是否需要支付至少 2.5 亿美元的罚款。

;;两只年长的黑人手拿着彩色传单或微笑的秃头黑人，穿着蓝色西装、白衬衫和蓝色红、白、蓝海地国旗前有红色条纹领带。
;

;一名退役哥伦比亚军官因参与;2021 年海地总统若弗内尔·莫伊兹遇刺;，给这个加勒比国家带来了前所未有的动荡。

;

;45 岁的 Germán Alejandro Rivera García 是在迈阿密被拘留并被指控并被判刑的 11 名嫌疑人中的第二人 ;美国检察官称这是在海地和佛罗里达州策划的一个阴谋;，目的是雇佣雇佣兵绑架或杀害莫伊兹，后者于 2021 年 7 月 7 日在海地首都太子港附近的私人住宅中被杀害。

;
;

;;相关：;;“这是一个温床”：迈阿密在海地谋杀案中的角色符合数十年的模式< /a>;

;
;

;里维拉，又名迈克上校，于 9 月承认密谋和支持刺杀海地总统的阴谋。根据法庭文件，在谋杀案发生当天，他是前往莫伊兹住所的车队的一员，此前他转达了计划不是绑架总统而是杀死他的信息。

;

;里维拉已经面对了现实被判处无期徒刑，并希望在与美国当局签署合作协议后获得较轻的刑罚。

;

;联邦法官何塞·E·马丁内斯 (José E Martínez) 周五在迈阿密举行的不到 30 分钟的听证会上做出了判决。

;

;在此之前，海地-智利商人鲁道夫·贾尔 (Rodolphe Jaar) 因参与谋杀莫伊兹而于 6 月被判处终身监禁。海地前参议员约翰·乔尔·约瑟夫将于 12 月被判刑。另外八名被告明年将在美国等待审判。

;

;里维拉穿着囚犯的米色衬衫和裤子参加听证会。他坐在律师旁边，聆听法官的裁决，双手被铐住，脚踝被铐住。

;

; Sat, 28 Oct 2023 00:22:01 +0800 No 10 plays down worries about Sunak’s AI safety summit having few top leadershttps://www.theguardian.com/technology/2023/oct/27/no-10-rishi-sunaks-ai-safety-summit-world-leaders
;;2023-10-27T15:54:51Z;
;
;;Rishi Sunak visits Moorfields eye hospital in London on the same day as giving a speech on artificial intelligence.
;

;No one is yet quite sure who will attend, or what, if anything will be decided, but Rishi Sunak's government is adamant that next week's AI safety summit is a vital first step towards getting to grips with a subject that is moving at a pace even the experts cannot fully comprehend.

;

;Understandable worries inside No 10 that the Israel-Gaza war could mean a summit lacking in world leaders have eased slightly with ;confirmation that; the European Commission president, Ursula von der Leyen, and the US vice-president, Kamala Harris, ;will attend;.

;

;In another early victory for the UK government, a series of leading AI companies, including OpenAI and Google DeepMind, have released their safety policies after a request from the technology secretary, Michelle Donelan.

;

;However, it still remains to be seen how many top-level figures will travel to Bletchley Park, Buckinghamshire, on Wednesday or Thursday – and if anyone at all from China will attend.

;

;The gathering at the country house, which was the base for second world war code-breaking, is a personal project for Sunak, whose ;speech about AI; on Thursday managed to both warn about the potentially existential threats posed by the technology while also trying to reassure the public it need not worry.

;

;Officials who have worked with the prime minister on the summit are dismissive about the focus on who will or will attend, and whether Harris's decision to use the first day of the event to make a separate speech in London on the US approach to the subject counts as a snub, saying the need for answers is so urgent that waiting is not an option.

;

;Sunak is being briefed that the next models of so-called frontier AI, intended to carry out a wide range of tasks, will arrive in less than a year and are so powerful – about 10bn times more so than their equivalent a decade ago – that not even the designers can be sure what they may achieve.

;

;The prime minister's official spokesperson confirmed that representatives from China were invited, with the intention of attracting “a broad range of attendees given the global nature of the challenge, and that it knows no borders”.

;

;The spokesperson added: “I'm not going to speculate on attendance. But of course, we want to secure the right group of countries, the right businesses, and I remain confident that we will we will have that.”

;

;The format will see a broader first day led by Donelan in which ministers, tech firms and other experts will gather to discuss the risks challenges posed by frontier AI.

;

;On the second day, Donelan collect together smaller groups for a session on ways the technology can be potentially regulated. Sunak will hold talks with what is described as “a small number of like-minded countries and companies” – with China very much not included.

;

;The summit is not expected to come up with solid ideas for regulation, and Sunak's hope that the UK can become the global centre for such work remains very much an aspiration.

;

;At the very least, he is hopeful that the country can play a leading role in such moves alongside the US, with the idea of the summit ;emerging during a trip; to Washington in June.

;

;“We will work extremely closely with the US,” Sunak's spokesperson said. “The US and the UK have the leading companies in this space. So it is logical that both the US and the UK would be at the forefront of it.”

; Sat, 28 Oct 2023 00:22:01 +0800 Ron DeSantis’s claim he sent military equipment to Israel unravelshttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/oct/27/ron-desantis-sending-weapons-israel-military-fake
;;2023-10-27T14:46:58Z;
;
;;Ron DeSantis
;

;Ron DeSantis is receiving pushback from Israeli diplomats, Florida Democrats and the White House after he falsely claimed credit for a gun-running operation to assist Israel's military operations in Gaza.

;

;The Florida governor and 2024 presidential hopeful declared on Thursday that he had worked with Israel's consul general in Miami to send military equipment, including drones, body armor and helmets.

;
;

;;Related: ;;DeSantis seeks to 'deactivate' pro-Palestinian student groups in Florida;

;
;

;His office, according to Reuters, said it had worked to “get weapons and ammunition to Israel through private parties” as part of his high-profile “;rescue operation;”. The operation involved sending humanitarian supplies on chartered planes and returning from Israel hundreds of US citizens who wanted to come home following the Hamas attacks.

;

;His boast, however, started to unravel when ;Maor Elbaz-Starinsky;, Israel's consul general, told the news agency he had not asked for DeSantis's help, and that the governor's involvement was limited to smoothing paperwork requirements for a previously arranged shipment of “rifle parts” ordered by his government.

;

;“I am not aware and would find it very, very bizarre to think that somebody is procuring weapons and sending it to Israel,” he said. “This is not how we work. And certainly not privately funded.”

;

;DeSantis has made hardline support of Israel a prominent part of his flailing campaign for the Republican presidential nomination, pledging to ;turn away Palestinian refugees; if he was in the White House, and ;expelling pro-Palestinian student groups; from Florida's university campuses.

;

;He has called a special session of the Florida legislature later this month to approve state sanctions on Iranian businesses and interests.

;

;With other presidential contenders, he will attend a donor gathering of the Republican Jewish Coalition in Las Vegas this weekend. On Friday, he will deliver a speech on foreign policy at the Heritage Foundation in Washington DC.

;

;Critics accuse him of acting as if he were president, and operating a de facto foreign policy from the governor's mansion in Tallahassee that is not under his purview.

;

;“President Biden is the commander in chief of our military, not Ron DeSantis,” said Nikki Fried, chair of the Florida Democratic party, in a statement ;to the Miami Herald;.

;

;“As a Navy veteran, Ron should understand the importance of respecting the chain of command. This is a gross breach of norms and a potential violation of federal laws governing the shipment of weapons.”

;

;John Kirby, strategic communications director for the National Security Council, told reporters at the White House on Thursday that he could not be certain DeSantis had “checked all the boxes”.

;

;“It is not illegal for the governor of a state to offer a measure of foreign assistance to another country [but] there are laws and regulations which govern how the export process is handled,” he said.

;

;“That's all done through commerce. I couldn't speak with authority today about whether the governor has checked all those boxes or not.”

;

;In a statement to the Guardian, a spokesperson for the Department of Commerce said they could not confirm details of particular transactions, but reminded US exporters “seeking to provide support for Israel” that appropriate federal authorizations were necessary.

;

;“Consistent with the president's direction, the Bureau of Industry and Security and our interagency partners are working to appropriately expedite applications for assistance to Israel,” the spokesperson said.

;

;Elbaz-Starinsky told the Herald that all necessary approvals for the rifle parts requested by Israel had been obtained, but said he was not certain it was DeSantis's office that helped secure them.

;

;“It was really the first days of the war, everyone was panicked and stressed, everything was urgent,” he told the newspaper.

;

;“I approached a few contacts, including the governor's office, to get the final approval. It went through all the process. I'm not even sure, at the end of the day, which one untangled this thing and made the shipment be approved.”

;

;DeSantis's office, meanwhile, has backed away from its initial claim it worked directly with the consul general to “help get weapons and ammunition”.

;

;Jeremy Redfern, the governor's press secretary, told Reuters DeSantis “was contacted by the consul general's office for assistance to clear federal bureaucratic hurdles associated with getting those items to Israel”.
